title.value: Hormonal activity of plant sterol glycosides

person.name: Polyanskaya, S.N., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). The V.F. Kuprevich Institute of Experimental Botany

organization.name: National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). The V.F. Kuprevich Institute of Experimental Botany

abstract.value: The physiological effect of plant steroid glycosides of furo and spirostanol series is researched in monograph. The peculiarities of the action of these substances on different processes of growth, flowering and fruit formation are analyzed; the influence of steroid glycosides on accumulation of biomass, grain yield and plant resistance to fungal infections, as well as the aftereffect on their offsprings is evaluated. General definition of steroid glycosides of plants is offered; the most important characteristics of steroid glycosides are enumerated. Distribution and localization of steroid glycosides in plants along with their participation in the growth and generative development is analyzed. Plant productivity within treatment with steroid glycosides is researched; anti-fungal effect of the substances is evaluated. Physiological and biochemical characteristics of the effect of steroid glycosides on plants are investigated. Seed germination and early seedlings' growth in the presence of steroid glycosides is analyzed; vegetative growth of plants under the influence of steroid glycosides, especially auxin action of steroid glycosides on the growth of plants is researched. The influence of steroid glycosides on the crop yield of green plants as well as the action of steroid glycosides on generative development of plants is presented. Antibiotic activity of steroid glycosides, their influence on the distribution and development of fungal diseases of plants, physiological and biochemical basis of the protective effect of steroid glycosides is evaluated. Some aspects of the practical application of steroid glycosides are suggested.
